plugin.name: ðŸŽ› Dashboard
plugin.description:
A Dashboard for NotePlan, that in one place shows
- a compact list of open tasks and checklists from today's note
- scheduled open tasks and checklists from other notes.
- Similarly for yesterday's note, tomorrow's note, and the weekly, monthly and quarterly notes too (if used)
- all overdue tasks
- all open tasks and checklists that contain particular @tags or #mentions of your choosing
- the next notes ready to review (if you use the 'Projects and Reviews' plugin).
plugin.author: @jgclark
plugin.lastUpdateInfo:
2.3.0: Start of support for NotePlan Teamspaces. New '/backupSettings' command. Added 'noteTags' feature (see README for details). Speeded up Tag/Mention sections. Layout improvements. Other small fixes and improvements.
2.2.1: Add new sorting option for Tag and Overdue sections.
2.2.0: Add 'Search' section. New keyboard shortcuts. Plus many small improvements, bug fixes and performance improvements. See documentation for details.
2.1.10: More move-under-heading options. Bug fixes and performance improvements.
2.1.9: performance improvements and better UI for iPhone users.
2.1.8: various fixes and small improvements.
2.1.7: various fixes and small improvements.
2.1.6: allow all current timeblocks to be shown, not just the first. Add new @repeat()s if using the extended syntax from the Repeat Extensions plugin. Bug fixes.
2.1.5: fixes to time blocks and scheduling items.
2.1.4: fix to Interactive Processing, and Edit All Perspectives dialog now shows unsaved changes.

plugin.settings.COMMENT: This is for use by the editSettings helper function. PluginID must match the plugin.id in the top of this file

plugin.settings.description: Saves last state of dashboardSettings as JSON string.
Saves current state of Perspective definitions as JSON string.

plugin.settings.title: Log Level
plugin.settings.description:
Set how much logging output will be displayed when executing Tidy commands in NotePlan Plugin Console Logs (NotePlan -> Help -> Plugin Console)

 - DEBUG: Show All Logs
 - INFO: Only Show Info, Warnings, and Errors
 - WARN: Only Show Errors or Warnings
 - ERROR: Only Show Errors
 - none: Don't show any logs

plugin.settings.title: Regex for Functions to show in debug log
plugin.settings.description: Overrides the Log Level above if this regex matches the first argument in log*() calls. If not set, has no effect.

plugin.settings.title: Enable Timer logging?
plugin.settings.description: For plugin authors to help optimise the plugin.

plugin.settings.title: All the rest of the Settings have been migrated to the Dashboard Window, so please make your changes there.
